==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|二|十|歳}}

===Etymology 1===
From Old Japanese はたち (twenty items).

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はたち}}

# [[twenty]] [[years]] [[old]]

====Usage notes====
Twenty is the age of majority in Japan.

===Etymology 2===
From Sino-Japanese [[二十]] ''nijū'' (twenty) and [[歳]] ''sai'' (years old).

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|にじゅっさい}}

# [[twenty]] [[years]] [[old]]

====Usage notes====
[[w:Jōyō kanji|Jōyō kanji]] recognized only じゅう and じっ as readings of [[十]] until 2010, even though the latter is actually pronounced じゅっ today and {{w|NHK}} accepted it already in 1966.
